Key Match Events: Greece's first goal restored their three-point lead at the top of the League B Group 2 table.
Josh Cullen and Nathan Collins dejected after Greece's first goal.
Republic of Ireland conceded so soon after half-time, a trend they need to address.
Republic of Ireland showed good courage and bravery to lift their performance in the second half.
Republic of Ireland's Josh Cullen praised the team's reaction after conceding early in the second half.
Greece's Mantalos scored the late goal, ending the match 2-0.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts favored Greece to win based on their current form.
Greece continued to hold the upper hand over Ireland as they capitalised on mistakes.
Heimir Hallgrímsson emphasized the importance of defending heroically in the first half.
Greece's victory over England on Thursday was not a fluke.
Ireland's last four encounters with Greece ended in Greek victories.
The match matters in the grander scheme of things for qualification for the European Championship finals.
Post-Match Reflections: Republic of Ireland manager Heimir Hallgrímsson acknowledged the need for improvement.
Ireland midfielder Josh Cullen reflected on the team's positive reaction after conceding early.
Ireland's next fixtures are against Finland and England, coming in a month’s time.
Miscellaneous Highlights: George Baldock, a Greece defender, was found dead at his home in Athens on Wednesday.
Ireland's starting team included players from various clubs, with Troy Parrott coming in for Finn Azaz.
